intro: Laportea gigas, commonly known as giant laportea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features large, showy yellow flowers surrounded by pale green ray florets, making it visually striking. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Laportea gigas is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
